title: I'm confused about bpsc … I'm a student of b.a 1st year … & want to start a bpsc preparation… I'll check a many sites even that list of books but I'm confused which book is most helpful for me … I wanna crack a bpsc … plzzz help me? - Quora
tags: Exam and Test Prep Book Recommendations

response.answer_text: Yup obviously anyone can be confused specially who's beginner in that line I mean civil service examinations. U hve choose bpsc which is also know as state pcs from this prospective 1st I would like to tell u how to choose books nd wht would have ur strategies regarding this exam.ok 1st read all NCERT from 6th to 12th bcoz this is called base during civil service or state pcs preparation ok 6th to 12th which means - 6–12th (political science, history, geography ) 6-10th (Science)*20 Questions asked from this section so pls don't skip this section. 9-12th (Indian economy) Now when u finished these books now u hve to move towards Standard books n what kind of standard books u will hve to purchase nd what should b approach on there .- 1)Indian polity-M.laxmikant 2)Modern history-Spectrum or Bipin chandra (any one no doubt ok ) 3)Medieval history-Satish Chandra or if u hve old ncert of this book than must go or otherwise buy Satish Chandra 4)Ancient history-Rakesh Sharma *don't worry if someone told u read only old ncert u must go on but if u don't hve any options than u hve to choose substitute which mean only Rakesh sharma . 5)India economy-Ramesh singh 6)Geography-Majid Hussain,Gc leongeh,and world Atlas 7)Art and culture-Nitin singhania 8)Current affairs-Drishti ias ,Ghatna chakra ,speedy ,Gk today,Vision ias (select any one only )any best trustable coaching centre .bcoz this section is most most important section specially in civil service or pcs .u can't ignore or skip 9)Bihar special -Crown publication. 10)General science-Lucent if u didn't read ncert than u can take a substitute. 11)Arihantt previous year practice set u must go on after u finished all these thing. I hope u will never confuse after read my preparation strategies. All the best…
